Context:
* Tanvir Singh Ahuja is a student in the Applied AI Solutions Development program at George Brown College.
* Melric Rego is a student in the Building Information Modelling program at George Brown College.
* Global Goals Jam Canada 2022 was held from March 18-20.
* The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) outlines Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), also known as Global Goals.
* Dark data constitutes 80% of all data in the world and will result in 5.8 million tonnes of carbon dioxide being released into the atmosphere this year.
* Tanvir Singh Ahuja participated in the Global Goals Jam 2021 competition and placed third.
* The team developed a business-to-business-to-consumer (B2B2C) model for dark data management.
* Teams were judged based on their pitches, uniqueness and feasibility of ideas, and scalability of business models.
* Ahuja and Rego's team received a $2,000 award for first place in the competition.
* Mentors provided guidance throughout the competition, including from Neal Lilliott, Manager of George Brownâ€™s entrepreneurial hub startGBC.
